intro: Lindsaea rigidiuscula, commonly known as the rigid little lindsaea, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, slender fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, where it can thrive in high humidity. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, a common feature among ferns. Lindsaea rigidiuscula is often found in rocky or humus-rich soils, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
